resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The geodyte can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the geodyte doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
entries: The geodyte can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 120 feet of it.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the geodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geodyte makes one claw attack and one tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and if the target is wearing metal armor or carrying a metal shield, the armor or shield takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dissolving Acid {@recharge 6}
entries: The geodyte spits dissolving acid in a line that is 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc} 13 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and any metal armor they are wearing receive a permanent and cumulative -1 to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

reaction.name: Opportunistic Hunger
entries: When a creature the geodyte can see within 5 feet of it hits it with a metal weapon, the geodyte can make a bite attack against that creature.

Bizarre creatures native to the Elemental Plane of Earth, xorn sniff out gemstones and precious metals, then tunnel through earth and rock to consume those treasures. On the Material Plane, xorn must range far and wide through the Underdark to sustain themselves, becoming aggressive toward miners and treasure hunters when the valuable minerals of their diet are scarce.

A xorn's unnatural origins are suggested by its unusually heavy body and the large, powerful mouth sitting atop its head. Its three long arms are each tipped with sharp talons, and its three large, stone-lidded eyes see in all directions.

entries.name: Elemental Travelers
entries: Possessed of the power of elemental earth, a xorn glides through stone and dirt as easily as a fish swims through water. It doesn't displace earth or stone when it moves, but merges with and flows through it, leaving no tunnel, hole, or hint of its passage.
